Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 9 ) wingspan 7.0̄ 10.5 mm . The male genitalia of
S. nitidana
( Fig. 17 ) are characterized by the tegumen produced triangularly to a narrowly rounded apex and the valva having an indistinct neck. In the female genitalia ( Fig. 19 ) the posterior margin of the 7th sternite is excavated to about half its length in a broad Ushape. It can be distinguished from its congeners by its conical phallus tapering to the apex.

Hosts. Fagaceae :
Quercus
spp.,
Fagus
spp.,
Betula
spp.,
Castanea
spp. ( Liu & Li 2002 ).
Distribution. China ( Gansu , Henan , Hubei , Jilin , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Yunnan , Zhejiang ), Japan , Russia , England .
